content.title: Star College Scheme For Strengthening Of Science Education And Training At Undergraduate Level
content.details: The Dept. of Biotechnology (DBT) has launched a scheme 'Star College Scheme for Strengthening of Science Education and Training at Undergraduate Level' for improving critical thinking and 'hands-on' experimental work at the undergraduate (college) level in sciences. It is expected to encourage more students to take up higher education in science. DBT will identify colleges with ambition and potential for excellence and provide academic and physical infrastructure for achieving excellence in teaching and unique exposure of students to experimental science.
benefits: One-time non-recurring grant of ₹10,00,000 per science department.
Recurring grant of ₹3,00,000 per science department per year for a period of three years.
Financial support for mentoring and monitoring per college.
Encouragement for the purchase of multiple copies of routine equipment required for science practicals.
eligibility: Minimum 4-5 UG courses in basic science.
Adequate in-house faculty expertise in each science department.
Independent laboratories for practicals to accommodate sanctioned student strength.
Lecture halls/rooms for theory classes with minimum capacity for sanctioned student strength.
Basic infrastructure and facilities in laboratories and library.
Colleges must be Government or Government aided, autonomous included under Section 2(f)/12(B) of the UGC Act 1956.
content.application_process: Online application via Epromis Portal. Hardcopy version of the proposal must be sent to the Department of Biotechnology.
documents_required: Rural Area Certificate for applicants from Rural Areas.

faqs.question: When Is The Call For DBT Star College Scheme Announced?
faqs.answer: The call for the DBT-Star College scheme for both Urban and Rural categories is announced annually and is advertised on the DBT website.

faqs.question: What Are The ‘Urban’ And ‘Rural’ Categories Of Colleges?
faqs.answer: Colleges have been categorized into Urban and Rural categories based on the physical location of the college.

faqs.question: Can A College Request Addition Of New Departments During The Ongoing Tenure Of Support?
faqs.answer: Colleges requesting the addition of new departments should first complete one cycle of support i.e. 3 years.
